headers: CLAUDE PRODUCTION PROTOCOL — AI CO-PILOT SPECIFICATION

rows.CLAUDE PRODUCTION PROTOCOL — AI CO-PILOT: Claude produces ≈80% of content. PM refines ≈20%. This is explicit, not hidden. It changes the workload math for every cluster.

rows.col_3: 120-150 hrs total. 2-3 long-form conversations/week (1-3 hrs each) + 15-min daily highlight. Doable with full-time job.
rows.col_4: Red flag → green. Was full-time, now ~10-12 hrs/week.

rows.col_3: High but assistable — Claude can explain any tab on demand

rows.col_4: No change. Expert reviews human-verified output.

rows.col_2: Read all P-tabs and C-tabs. Generate first-draft content for any C-tab. Structural check on V-tabs (advisory, 0% grade weight). Explain any tab to any role on demand. Generate implementation task lists from locked TUPs.
Record grades on V-tabs. Lock any tab or TUP. Grant or vest equity. Make strategic decisions. Override any human judgment. Interact with people without PM mediation.
PM prompts Claude with P-tab spec → Claude generates draft → PM reviews, edits, refines → PM submits to Librarian. Claude's output always passes through a human filter before entering the system.

Librarian can ask Claude: "explain what this tab is supposed to contain" or "check if this tab matches the P-tab spec." Claude = on-demand reference for the Librarian. Reduces cognitive load of learning 1,184 tabs.
Expert Reviewer can ask Claude for pre-review summary: "what is this TUP about and what are the key claims." Claude saves expert time on context-gathering. Expert grades substance, not structure.

rows.col_3: 210+ hours over 12 weeks. Claude doesn't change this — MC is the human layer. Comp needs to be honest about full-time commitment. 1-3% equity + $1-2K/month may be thin. Career booster (200+ hrs of hosted content for reel) is the real draw. Must hire someone who treats this as THEIR show.
120 tabs even at 80/20 is 60-120 PM hours. Consider splitting into CL-6a and CL-6b, or extending to 3-4 week sprint. Feasible but tight.
Claude-as-reference eliminates the impossible ask of memorizing 1,184 tabs. Librarian learns by asking Claude. Cognitive load drops from "memorize everything" to "know how to ask Claude."
